chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Sexual Assault of Child without Great Bodily Harm
1st Degree Sexual Assault of Child without Great Bodily Harm
1st Degree Sexual Assault of Child without Great Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott K Castle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Causing Mental Harm to Child, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.04(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied.  PAID IN FULL.  Balance of cash bail to be refunded to poster.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
Mental health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate by the agent.

Sex offender treatment.
Compliance with the Sex Offender Registry.
No unsupervised contact with any minor females under the age of 17 years old.
Not to possess any pornography.
No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
No contact with any of the victim's or their mother listed in the criminal comlaint (unless they allow for contact and under their conditions and with the agent's approval).
Comply with any other court order.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

Filed by DOC - Requesting clarification of the probationary term ordered on count 1, including attachments.
02/09/17 - Court Reviewed - Corrected JOC to be prepared.

Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Scott K Castle in court with attorney Thomas C Simon.

Victims (L.C. & L.C.) presented a statement to the court.
Victim's mother presented a statement to the court.
  
State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.


Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  10 Years.
Initial Confinement:  5 Years.
Extended Supervision:  5 Years.
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.


Term of Probation:  7.5 Years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Sex Offender Treatment.
Compliance with the Sex Offender Registry.
No unsupervised contact with any minor females under the age of 17 years old.
Not to possess any pornography.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended by the agent;
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  victim's or their mother listed in the criminal complaint - (Unless they allow for the contact and under their conditions and with the agent's approval).
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate by the agent.
DNA sample to be provided.
Comply with any other court order.

Costs:  $113
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply Bail and Refund Balance to the posting party.

CONDITION TIME: 
1 Year in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
First 6 Month to be served - FORTHWITH.
Defendant remanded to the custody of the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.
Last 6 Months - Stayed - to be used at the agent's discretion.
